product_specification.In The Box: iPhone, USB-C to Lightning Cable, Documentation
product_specification.Other Display Features: Super Retina XDR Display, 6.1 inch (Diagonal) All Screen OLED Display, HDR Display, True Tone, Wide Colour (P3), Haptic Touch, 2000000:1 Contrast Ratio (Typical), 625 nits Max Brightness (Typical); 1200 nits Max Brightness (HDR), Fingerprint-resistant Oleophobic Coating, Support for Display of Multiple Languages and Characters Simultaneously
product_specification.Processor Type: A14 Bionic Chip with Next Generation Neural Engine
product_specification.Primary Camera Features: Dual 12MP Camera System (Ultra Wide and Wide), Ultra Wide: f/2.4 Aperture, Wide: f/1.6 Aperture, Night Mode, Deep Fusion, Optical Image Stabilisation, 2x Optical Zoom Out, Digital Zoom Upto 5x, Portrait Mode with Advanced Bokeh and Depth Control, Portrait Lighting with Six Effects (Natural, Studio, Contour, Stage, Stage Mono, Highâ€‘Key Mono), Smart HDR 3 for Photos, Video: 4K Video Recording at 24 fps, 30 fps or 60 fps, 1080p HD Video Recording at 30 fps or 60 fps, HDR Video Recording with Dolby Vision Upto 30 fps, Extended Dynamic Range for Video Upto 60 fps, Optical Image Stabilisation for Video, 2x Optical Zoom Out, Digital Zoom Upto 3x, Audio Zoom, QuickTake Video, Slow-motion Video Support for 1080p at 120 fps or 240 fps, Night Mode Time-lapse, Time-lapse Video with Stabilisation, Stereo Recording
product_specification.Secondary Camera Features: TrueDepth Camera, 12MP Photos, f/2.2 Aperture, Smart HDR 3 for Photos, Portrait Mode with Advanced Bokeh and Depth Control, Portrait Lighting with Six Effects (Natural, Studio, Contour, Stage, Stage Mono, High-Key Mono), Extended Dynamic Rnge for Video at 30 fps, Cinematic Video Stabilisation (4K, 1080p and 720p), 4K Video Recording at 24 fps, 30 fps or 60 fps, HDR Video Recording with Dolby Vision Upto 30 fps, 1080p HD Video Recording at 30 fps or 60 fps, Slow-motion Video Support for 1080p at 120 fps, Night Mode, Deep Fusion, QuickTake Video, Animoji and Memoji
product_specification.Flash: Rear: Brighter True Tone Flash with Slow Sync | Front: Retina Flash
product_specification.Video Recording Resolution: 4K, 1080P, HDR Video Recording with Dolby Vision Upto 30 fps
product_specification.Digital Zoom: Photo: Digital Zoom Upto 5x, Video: Digital Zoom Upto 3x
product_specification.Sensors: Face ID, Barometer, Three-axis Gyro, Accelerometer, Proximity Sensor, Ambient Light Sensor
product_specification.Other Features: Splash, Water and Dust Resistant (Rated IP68 (Maximum Depth of 6 Metres Upto 30 Minutes) Under IEC Standard 60529), Ceramic Shield Front, Aerospace-grade Aluminium, Compatible with MagSafe Accessories and Wireless Chargers, Audio Playback: Spatial Audio Playback, Supports Dolby Atmos, Video Playback: HDR with Dolby Vision, HDR10 and HLG
product_specification.GPS Type: Built-in GPS, GLONASS, Galileo, QZSS and BeiDou
product_specification.Audio Formats: Audio Formats Supported: AAC‑LC, HE‑AAC, HE‑AAC v2, Protected AAC, MP3, Linear PCM, Apple Lossless, FLAC, Dolby Digital (AC‑3), Dolby Digital Plus (E‑AC‑3), Dolby Atmos and Audible (Formats 2, 3, 4, Audible Enhanced Audio, AAX and AAX+), Spatial Audio Playback

product_description.To Behold and Be Held: Enjoy video content in superb contrast and high resolution as this phone packs the Super Retina XDR Display. Ceramic Shield, on the other hand, makes for up drop performance that’s better by up to 4 times.
product_description.Let's Speed Things Up: Download, upload, and even stream content at speeds up to 2 Gbps – all thanks to 4G LTE.
product_description.The Chip That Pushes What's Possible: With a 16-core Neural Engine, the A14 Bionic chip, along with up to 64 GB of ROM, gives this smartphone the speed to execute innumerable tasks in the blink of an eye. It also helps the battery perform more efficiently.
product_description.Low Light Is Now a Highlight: Courtesy of Night Mode, your photos and selfies will boast every possible detail even in dimly lit conditions. While its wide camera helps draw in up to 27% more light, the ultra wide camera helps capture Night Mode images.
Using this phone, you can record, edit, and even playback Dolby Vision Video. You can also take advantage of AirPlay, should you want to stream it on your Apple TV or smart TV. Additionally, Night Mode Time-lapse Video helps you capture lights and trails with the help of a tripod, and 10-bit HDR Video Recording ensures that you enjoy about 60 times more colours than what you’d otherwise get in an 8-bit Video Recording.
product_description.Snap on a Magnetic Case, Wallet or Both: You can easily attach a magnetic case, wallet, or even both of them to this phone to make things convenient.
product_description.Lose Yourself in 70 Million Songs: Choose from up to 70 million songs, download them, and even play them offline to your heart’s content.

This was an awesome buy. I bought this phone for my father who was upgrading from an iPhone 6. He is very happy with this phone. The size is really good. He said that it was even more comfortable to hold than the 6 as it had flat sides. It is Smaller than most android phones but big enough for anything and everything.

The performance is Stellar. You won't notice any lag and it's very fast. Ram management is good too. And the phone stays at a reasonable temperature even when using Gmaps.

The battery life is good. Not as good as most android phones but the efficiency of this processor is really good. You will have to buy a charger for 1800 rupees and that is a genuine inconvenience. Even though it charges at a good rate when charged using my mac mini usb c port.

The camera is awesome. It takes some awesome photos and the video is just pure wizardry. It drains battery pretty fast while recording 4k videos which is expected due to the heavy processing and HDR it is doing. 30 fps videos can be shot at dolby vision HDR.

The display doing 60hz is fine. It's very bright and sharp. You will get used to the notch in no time. 120hz would've been appreciated though. Speakers too are awesome. Stereo speakers make it very enjoyable. The haptics is next level and i am very happy with it.

I have been a pixel lover and pixel user for so many years. The only reason for shifting to Apple was the ease of content creation on iOS environment.
Google hasn't been launching new pixel devices in India for almost 3 years now and that is really disappointing. My review is based upon the difference between the 2.

Apple lovers may not like my review but even though there is a lot of difference between google and apple, I've still rated the phone as a 4 star product.

I will start with...

***** Camera *****

Still photography is still much better on a pixel device. In fact, the pixel 4a clicks better stills than iPhone 12 (as per my experience). However, pixels video quality has been really disappointing. Specially with front camera. This is where iPhone beats pixel. You are not just going to click stills but also would like to take good quality videos. Content creation is all about cameras that are good in doing the both. Hence, I would say iPhone beats pixel because of the video quality and a good (not the best) still photography.


***** Battery Backup *****

Amazing!! Just amazing! Again, this is based on the comparison between iOS and Android. I've heard that battery backup on iPhone 12 is not that good but someone who is coming from and Android environment will notice a considerable difference. You can opt for iPhone 11 if battery is a major issue for you.


***** Siri vs. Google Assistant *****

Siri is no where around GA. There's a legitimate reason for this. Google has been collecting data for so many years. Hence, the GA is smart enough to respond to and act accordingly. Context switching is what I miss when I use iPhone 12. But that's Google vs Apple and not something that is related to iPhone 12. So chill!!

***** Look & Feel *****

5 stars! Hands down!

Writing this review after 50 days of ‘heavy’ use.

• The performance is just flawless. I played BGMI usually 6-7 hrs daily for 25-30 days (both classics and tournaments) with screen recording and never got even a single framedrop.

• Battery performance is also good. While playing heavy games continuously it gives a backup of around 4hrs and around 3-1/2 hrs with screen recording. If u are not playing heavy games then the battery will last all day long and there will be still left around 20% by the end of the day.

• Camera performance is excellent in good light conditions and in low light is also good but could’ve been better since the shutter limit in night mode is only 10secs but its enough.

• Display is lovely. I have compared it to that of iphone11’s and yes it is noticeably better.

Undoubtedly awesome in performance, after all it’s 🍎, didn’t like battary backup though, with heavy usage can’t survive for a day, need to juice up in evening, another disadvantage is No fast charging.. Camera is good but not best out there and also keep in mind there is no file manager for data management and data sharing is not as easy as android.

Great service by Flipkart. Iphone 12 is just awesome. The only con is they must provide charger. The battery is not that much great but works for a day if sufficiently charged.

Pros:
- Same screen quality compared to 12 Pro. Features are also mostly similar except for a few (for example, three back cameras instead of two), which is not a matter of concern for me.
- Consistent and super-smooth user experience of iOS. (If you are looking for feature richness, better to go with Android)
- Predictable battery life. This means, if your phone is on standby with 2% battery left, you will see the almost same battery percentage even after 2 hours.
- Square-shaped design comparing to iPhone 11 brings a little more compact feel. Also, the phone is lighter.

Cons:
- iPhone 13 is getting released this month. But, still, feature-wise, not much difference unless you are not going for 13 Pro (120Hz refresh screen). So, this may still provide value if the prices are reduced.
- Not much difference between iPhone 11, except the OLED screen, compared to LED. You will not notice the difference if you are not spending too much time in bright conditions. Practically, not much difference in Battery life either.

Conclusion:
For an average user, I feel the experience with the Phone will be similar for iPhone 11, iPhone 12 and iPhone 13. So, make the decision based on budget.
- If you are looking for a substantially better value comparing to iPhone 11, go with iPhone 13 pro because of its 120 Hz variable refresh rate if your budget allows it.
- Go with iPhone 12 if you value square design. Otherwise, iPhone 11 will be a better choice for a cheaper cost.
- Spending on iPhone 13 doesn't make much sense for me comparing the features and design with iPhone 12. Buy iPhone 12 if you don't have the budget for iPhone 13 Pro.

Cons

2. iCloud storage is painfully limited

Over a Decade long android user switching to the iPhone for the first time.

For the longest time i was an android fanboy, on account of being a power user who always wanted to customise things as per my requirement.

I’ve come from using different Sony devices to 3 different OnePlus devices to the Apple iPhone.

I weighed the pros and cons as one would with all the fairness one can impart while making a personal choice of buying a smartphone. Pros being that android was highly customisable, open source-ish, lots of freedom.

Cons being the instability of the OS, the apps built on it, the crashes, bugs, etc. And overall the aesthetic being more function-focused and less on beauty.

As I grew up in life, my priorities changed. And with that, the time and resulting inclination i had for the functional aspect of the phone.

I realised that the number of apps i used on my phone had come down to the handful of basics - such as the dialler, camera, email and a handful of social media apps. This is when I started evaluating the differences between the androids and iPhones of the world and I found myself increasingly siding with the PROS of an apple device whereas caring less and less about the cons of one.

The iPhone is an incredibly powerful device.

- Camera is best in the business (Sharp lens, true colours, great 4k video, the works..)
- As long as you can bear the notch, the display is straight gorgeous. The colours are just a class apart and the display PPI and smooth transitions make it an absolute buttery delight.
- Call quality is superior compared to any android phone I’ve used
- Compact design (although its got a little bit of weight to it, which might not be an issue for most people seeing as it is well distributed)
- Stability: Hasn’t crashed/died/hung on me a single time (I’ve seen the most powerful android phones hang and crash at times)
- The little things: Some incredible gestures (Certain kind of taps that make useful menus pop up, when you immediately switch from one music app to another it gently decreases the volume of your existing music and then gently increases the volume of your new music like a fade out-fade in, and more such things i discover every day).

I don’t think I’ll be switching back to another OS as this one just handles everything beautifully.

Hope this helps some confused android user who’s wondering whether to pull the trigger and make the switch.

The phone as well as OS are very good, although there are some drawbacks such as camera, UI and battery are so-so...

There's no back button, you can only go to home screen or use the back buttons on the topmost left on the app...

Camera is sometimes excellent, such as while taking selfies, if people join in it automatically widens out, sometimes under performing, such as in the night or in daytime if there's too much brightness...

There's no T9 suggestive dialer too, you have to use contacts app or remember the whole number, after which tells you the name...

You cannot arrange icons on your own, they always go to the topmost left corner and you also cannot keep any blank screen if you want to use a beautiful wallpaper...

You cannot really arrange the control center as per your wish...
It’s everything you expect from an iPhone🤩

Good choice!!
Got from NVIGR retails, authentic product faster delivery. Phone is good, I moved from 6s to 12 so at first, felt bulky but with time perhaps one would get used to it. Price wise it’s ok for 54k. So overall it’s good, yet to check the battery sustainability, though I guess it can do around 7-9 hours screen on time. Form factor is seemingly handy given the fact that bigger phones are trend, however if someone wants the slick convenience of single handed usage then 12/13 mini are better options , though there are a few caveats while choosing mini options - 1) 12 mini battery around 6 hrs screen on time , which is quite less , 2) 13 mini holds same screen on time as compared to 12 however it’s price is higher side; if budget is not your concern and you want handy phone then 13 mini can be a go-to choice. 3) In case you want to spend time on bigger screens like playing games watching video, browsing, basically if entertainment is all also a part of your usage, then mini won’t render you with the desired experience. With Apple, I believe, buying a year post the release of the device can save a considerable amount of money over buying on release date, hence 12 is apparently a right choice right now. Few tips while ordering and taking delivery - 1) when ordering , make sure to check Flipkart assured icon and check the seller rating 2) while taking delivery - ask the agent to open the box for you while you make a video of unboxing 3) the IMIE number on the box should match with number on the bill. 4) Apple has introduced a QR code seal tab on the packing of the phone, make sure the seal is there and intact. Post delivery , you can check the imie number in general setting of the iPhone and match it with the bill. In iPhone setting, You can also check the warranty tab and check the time stamp that is one year from the date of your iPhone purchase, this will assure the coverage of Apple company warranty. Also, you can check online, with the serial number of the device entered on apple office website can also help you check the authenticity of the product. With all these check you can assure the legitimacy of the phone.
Given 4 out of 5 basis my expectations from Apple; in-display finger print, a little more handy device along with a better battery would have garnered 5/5 here. Overall it’s a good phone, Flipkart is genuine, NVIGR seller is authentic , product is genuine.
Hope this review helps.

I have been avid user of android before purchasing my first iPhone. Used two one plus devices before this and was in dilemma to switch to apple or not. I have iPad Air 2 which lasted me 5 years and still running great so thought of giving iPhone a try and went to iPhone 12 green 64gb model.
First look was great I like the 6.1 inch which perfectly fits in my hand. Green colour is really nice and fresh. I opted for 64 gb and waited for big billion sale to get it. Got it for 43k after bank discount which is really brilliant.
Display is really good. I am in dilemma to go for 11 or 12 but just for the latest led display I opted 12. Colours are bright and crisp.
Phone is fast as of now. Didn’t tried games yet.
Battery should have been better. We have to charge it daily considering the moderate usage. Good thing is phone charges really fast compared to old models thanks to 20 w fast charging technology.
For android user it takes a bit time to adjust to the apple interface. But apple interface is very good fast and you will get habituate to it soon.
They should at least provide 90hz as this model is only 60hz which is very outdated when compared to latest android models. You will find the difference clearly when you are browsing.
Charging adapter is not given in my box. This is really a big thing as we have to shell out 2k again for the adapter to enjoy the phones fast charging technology. But I purchased iPad Air latest version along with this mobile so I am using the iPads adapter for this which sorted my problem.
Headphones are not provided they should at least provide wired headphones which will be basic requirement for everyone. Shelling out again is a big thing.
Camera is great pics taken with this are really good. Will update the pics shortly.
Overall I can say this is best option to try an iPhone. 12 is good option now compared to 13. iPhone 13 is not that good upgrade compared to earlier iPhone models.
Go for 128 gb if you can afford or else you can buy a pen drive which supports apple device and keep that as backup.
Hope my review helps.

This iPhone 12 was replacing Android , so it was always going to be a huge step up in performance, and this has not disappointed at all. The new A14 chip makes light work of alternating between apps, camera and other functions of the phone, everything is so quick and the display is crisp and bright.

The camera quality is outstanding, as a keen photographer, it is difficult now to decipher what has been taken with a dedicated camera (in my case a Panasonic LUMIX) or with the iPhone itself. The dedicated camera just takes it on a whisker, as some of the iPhone pictures (on landscapes for example), can look slightly unnatural as the software post processes the picture to brighten the image and compensate for the small lens (in comparison to a dedicated camera)

I hope my review isn’t removed by Flipkart because it’s not one with only praise. Well, the device is typically apple.. well built, smooth experience etc. However I personally didn’t find it to be an upgrade from my iPhone X really. People who are upgrading from X or Xs will know what I mean. The screen has a warmer hue, I was told this warmer tone is more accurate than the cooler one on previous models. The in hand feel according to me is far more premium on the iPhone X but it might be due to it’s steel chassis against that of the iPhone 12 which is aluminium. And I found some pre-defined sounds like the lock sound, bedtime reminder, message tone to be considerably lower than that of the iPhone X. I got the 128 GB variant in exchange at 42 k, the lowest I ever imagined on Flipkart. Comparatively with Android, since I was a hardcore Android user, these are my reviews after a week use:

Pros:
1. The best thing and the most stunning feature is the display. You will absolutely fall in love with it, I damn guarantee you.
2. Camera is superb. Even in low light it woks awesome.
3. The face unlock interface is very fast.
4. Performance is smooth, no lags no freezing.
5. Battery is very good for me as I don’t play much high end games except some. It gets me for at least 12-14 hours which is fair.

Cons:
1. As I just switched so I face some difficulties while switching apps or pressing back button, it will overcome by use.
2. Everything is paid, so you have to spend some extra bucks or better subscribe to ota apps.
3. No adapter to charge, had to buy 20W separately.
4. The eSIM is not as good as it says. Some apps don’t run unless they detect sim, mostly bank apps.
5. Image format is HEIF/HEVC. If you are switching to JPEG, you will lose the 4K 60 fps feature.

1. The premium feel is the most important thing one can deserve…this phone is the best one to have that feeling.
2. The most satisfactory thing is the battery performance…you can use the phone whole day after having full charge in the morning. Battery draining is very less unless you’re doing some heavy work.
3. Now talking about the camera experience…the camera is a bit low graded in comparison with android…in this price point android provides you a better camera quality and many editing options…but iPhone is more concentrated about sharpness of the image…the pic you click is the sharpest one but not very detailed one like android…still it’s a 12+12MP camera.
4. The OLED Display is super smooth and you will fall in love with it’s smoothness…a bit orgasmic😜.
5. The backup platform i.e. iCloud is not very satisfactory…it provides only 5GB of backup capacity in built…you have to pay a good amount per month to increase it to 50GB…that’s not what you expect from this phone.
6. One problem that I faced recently just for one time that is when I tried to click a picture of some tasty momos…suddenly the camera application hanged and my phone just switched off automatically…after turning on it behaves normally…I’m still confused what happened then…may be a bug that I have to fix,god knows.
7. You will get all your necessary applications for free from App Store.
8. Most importantly, buy this phone only from a reputed retailer and check the ratings of that particular retailer…if it’s above 4.5⭐️..then only buy from that retailer…otherwise you may get an iFone instead of an iPhone😝

So, according to me the phone is almost perfect for those who want performance for their work purpose…but if you’re a gamer and thinking of buying an iPhone 12, don’t buy it…it’s not for gaming…yeah you can run BGMI or PUBG or CODM peacefully but try avoiding games
So signing off by telling you last few words…don’t hesitate…just remember those above mentioned points and purchase it…afterall it’s an iPhone 12.😌
